Description: Rectangular piece of ivory inlay: unbroken, decorated with incised lines in a diamond pattern. The piece is slightly curved and is pierced by a single hole, in the middle of the width. The edges and back are flat and smooth. Good condition.
Curator's comments: For pieces with the same pattern, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.XXXVIII, 69-70; XL, 57, 59, 65; XLI, 4-6; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ I, (1895-6), pl. XLII; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ II (Berlin, 1929-31), no. 295 and pl. 36. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 36, pl.XL, 69, centre piece of the group.
